text.section: From among the members of the Commission, the Governor shall appoint a chairman.

section.section: The Chairman is the administrative and executive head of the Commission.

Subject to paragraph (3) of this subsection, the Chairman has final authority over:
the administrative work of the Commission and its employees; and
the assignment of cases for hearing.

The Chairman does not have final authority over:
the adoption of regulations by the Commission; or
the conduct of hearings and the determination of cases by the other members of the Commission.

text.section: The Chairman shall conduct hearings unless the hearings interfere with the adequate and efficient performance of the administrative and executive functions of the Chairman.
